page.title: 02Skipwith Common
page.content: Skipwith Common is a disused second world war airfield, flanked by silver birch trees and dotted with standing water; a strange mixture of heather, bog, bracken, nettle, footpath and moss green tarmac. The Common is owned by Mr Nigel Forbes-Adams as part of his Escrick Estate.Bye-laws have safe- guarded the natural beauty of the Common. The Common has thus avoided the heavy hand of modern farming methods. It is an island of uncultivated land surrounded by a sea of rich arable fields. The Common extends for around 1,000 acres, 600 of which are included in the Yorkshire Wildlife Trust's Nature Reserve. The Trust's nature trail takes in two of the old airfield runways and passes Danes' Hill.
